post.description: build will attempt to trigger a build. If the git hash has already been built before, it can be triggered with just `acctRepo` and `hash` fields. If it has not been built before, the `branch` field is required as well.

get.summary: get runtime specification of a specific build
get.description:
buildRuntime is used for getting node details for an active build. When you query via a hash, ocelot will do a lookup in postgres for the top-level build information, then look in consul to find all of the runtime data, ie the werker node's ip and port for streaming build logs. 
 If the build is finished and streaming logs should query the admin instead of the werker nodes, then the bool field `Done` will be true.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: hash is the git hash that corresponds to a commit you wish to get information on.

parameters.name: buildId
parameters.description: buildId is the build number given by ocelot that is associated with the commit.

parameters.name: strip
parameters.description: strip will return builds without ansi // tty formatting.

Refer to modelsAppleCreds for the object fields

@inject_tag: yaml:"subType".

parameters.description:
clientSecret is generated by creating an oAuth consumer in bitbucket. it is required to generate tokens.
@inject_tag: yaml:"clientSecret".

tokenUrl is the url at which to retrieve the token
@inject_tag: yaml:"tokenURL".

 - NEXUS: / REPO ///

post.summary: Attach ssh key to VCS Account
post.description:
Attach the contents of an ssh file to a vcs account. This file will be attached to the build container for cloning the repository. subType is a required query param 
Refer to modelsSSHKeyWrapper for the object fields

get.summary: stream logs of a previous build
get.description:
get stream of logs for a specific build. can either query by buildId or hash, if buildId is specified it takes precendence over hash. 
 This method will error out if the build is still active. Active builds MUST be streamed from the werkers themselves, and  you must call /v1/buildruntime to retrive the werker connection information  
if hash is specified and there are multiple builds with the same hash, ocelot will stream the latest one. 
Refer to modelsBuildQuery for object fields

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: hash is the git hash that corresponds to a commit you wish to get information on.

parameters.name: buildId
parameters.description: buildId is the build number given by ocelot that is associated with the commit.

parameters.name: strip
parameters.description: strip will return builds without ansi // tty formatting.

get.summary: list all repositories that are being polled for changes
get.description: list all repositories that are being polled for changes

post.summary: set up git poll tracking for a repository
post.description: poll will set up a polling request. `account`, `repo`, `cron`, and `branches` are all required fields.

delete.summary: delete poll tracking for a repo

parameters.name: cron
parameters.description: cron is the cron string that will determine how often a check for changes should occur.

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: branches tells ocelot which branches should be checked for changes.

parameters.name: lastCronTime
parameters.description: internal use only.

get.summary: get detailed status on every stage in a build
get.description: GetStatus will return the status of a specific build. Hierarchy for key to lookup with: if `hash` supplied, ocelot will only get status by hash. If `acctName` and `repoName` are supplied and not hash, it will be used as a key for looking up status. If only `partialRepo` is given in the request, ocelot will attempt to find a match and return the latest build stage details for that.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: hash is the git hash to get status of.

parameters.name: acctName
parameters.description: acctName is the corresponding account that the hash is attached to.

parameters.name: repoName
parameters.description: repoName is the corresponding repo name that the hash is attached to.

parameters.name: partialRepo
parameters.description: partialRepo is just the first n letters of repo.

parameters.name: buildId
parameters.description: buildId is the database build id corresponding to the build you need status of.

get.summary: retrive summaries corresponding to an account & repo
get.description: will return summaries of the builds for the corresponding repo/account. limit will set how many entries will be returned

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit is the number of summary records desired to be returned.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
type is the vcs type fo the account and repo.

 - BITBUCKET: / VCS ///
 - NEXUS: / REPO ///
 - KUBECONF: / K8S ///
 - SSHKEY: / SSH ///
 - SLACK: / NOTIFY ///
 - DEVPROFILE: / APPLE ///
 - ENV: / GENERIC ///

get.summary: get list of all currently tracked account/repos

post.summary: create a webhook in bitbucket for a repository
post.description: watch will set up a webhook for the given repo/account. `repo`, `account`, and `limit` are required fields in the POST body

get.summary: get details of node running specific build
get.description: get network location of werker that is currrently executing a build on the specifed hash. use when you want to kill a specific build to get werker node info.

parameters.name: acctRepo
parameters.description: acctRepo is the ocelot account to which the creds are uploaded and the repository you wish to operate on, in the form account/repo.

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: branch is the branch that corresponds to the git hash. if the git hash has never been built by ocelot, this field is required.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: force is a flag that says to build even if it doesn't match the acceptable branches list and even if there is a "skip" ci message.

parameters.name: vcsType
parameters.description:
vcsType is the vcs sub cred type that is associated with the acct/repo you wish to build.
 GITHUB|BITBUCKET. If this is not passed in a build request then the credentials table will be checked
 to see if there is only one account with that name to infer subcredtype from. If there is more than one
 account with different subcredtypes, then an error will be returned to and it will be required to pass this
 field.

 - BITBUCKET: / VCS ///
 - NEXUS: / REPO ///
 - KUBECONF: / K8S ///
 - SSHKEY: / SSH ///
 - SLACK: / NOTIFY ///
 - DEVPROFILE: / APPLE ///
 - ENV: / GENERIC ///

lastQueue.title: lastqueue last time build was queued

modelsAcctRepo.title: Used in displaying all repos that are tracked by ocelot

modelsAcctRepos.title: AcctRepos is used in the response to /v1/tracked-repositories, it is an array of AcctRepo objects. have to wrap it cuz proto -_-

repoCreds.title:
All repository credentials for integrations
@inject_tag: yaml:"repoCreds"

vcsCreds.title:
All VCS credentials for building
@inject_tag: yaml:"vcsCreds"

acctName.title: account name to associate this credential with

identifier.title: identifier in dev profile creds is currently irrelevant, as there can only be one per account

appleSecrets.title: appleSecrets is the zip contents of the apple developer profile that you export in XCode ??

appleSecretsPassword.title: appleSecretsPassword is the password you set when you export the developer profile

id.title: id is credentials id from database

acctRepo.title: acctRepo is the ocelot account to which the creds are uploaded and the repository you wish to operate on, in the form account/repo

hash.description: hash is the git hash to trigger.

branch.description: branch is the branch that corresponds to the git hash. if the git hash has never been built by ocelot, this field is required.

force.title: force is a flag that says to build even if it doesn't match the acceptable branches list and even if there is a "skip" ci message

vcsType.title:
vcsType is the vcs sub cred type that is associated with the acct/repo you wish to build.
 GITHUB|BITBUCKET. If this is not passed in a build request then the credentials table will be checked
 to see if there is only one account with that name to infer subcredtype from. If there is more than one
 account with different subcredtypes, then an error will be returned to and it will be required to pass this
 field

done.title: done says whether or not the build has completed

ip.title: ip is the ip of the werker node that is running the build

grpcPort.title: grpcPort is the grpc port of the werker running the build

hash.title: hash is the git hash that is currently being built

acctName.title: acctName is the vcs account that this build is assocated with

repoName.title: repoName is the name of the git repository that is associated with this commit/build

hash.title: hash is the git commit hash that corresponds with this build information

failed.title: failed is whether or not the build failed

buildTime.title: buildTime is the datetime that the build was picked up off the queue by the werker

account.title: account is the VCS account associated with the repository / commit

buildDuration.title: buildDuration is the length of time the whole build took to execute

repo.title: repo is the repository associated with the account / commit

branch.title: branch is the branch associated with the commit when it was pushed

buildId.title: buildId is the id given to the build entry by postgres. it is unique

queueTime.title: queueTime is the datetime that either a tracking component or the admin put the build request on the queue to be processed by the werker node

status.title: status is the current status of the build as known by the database

modelsBuildSummary.description:
BuildSummary represents the build_summary table in postgres
it is a top level view of how a repository is "doing" in ocelot, ie build times, fail status..

modelsCredWrapper.title: just a container for a list of VCSCreds

identifier.title: identifier is the unique identifier for the integration

k8sContents.title: k8scontents is the contents of the kubeconfig file

identifier.title: identifier in K8s creds, typically the name of the cluster, as expected use case is one config per cluster

subType.title:
@inject_tag: yaml:"subType"
there is currently only one subtype for k8SCreds, and it is KUBECONF

  add {{detailUrlBase}}/repos/{{account}}/{{repo}}/{{buildId}}

id.title: id is credentials id from database

repo.title: repo is the VCS repository name

cron.title: cron is the cron string that will determine how often a check for changes should occur

branches.title: branches tells ocelot which branches should be checked for changes

type.title: type is the vcs subcredtype, ie github|bitbucket

modelsPollRequest.description: PollRequest encompasses all the data necessary to set up poll tracking in ocelot.

modelsPolls.title: polls is a wrapper for a PollRequest list because protobuf can be dumb

limit.title: limit is the number of summary records desired to be returned

type.title: type is the vcs type fo the account and repo

modelsRepoCredWrapper.title: container for list of repo creds

repoUrl.title:
@inject_tag: yaml:"repoUrl"
repoUrl is the url that is associated with that repository, for example hub.docker.io

identifier.title: identifier is the unique identifier that is associated with this acctName

acctName.title:
@inject_tag: yaml:"acctName"
account name (same as from vcs)

there are two subtypes that are valid for RepoCreds: DOCKER, NEXUS

privateKey.title: the contents of the private key

identifier.description: identifier is the unique identifier for when an ssh key is not associated with a VCS account.

id.title: id is credentials id from database

error.title: error is the error message; will either be populated by a stage not returning exit code 0 or an error handled in the code during the build

status.title: status is whether or not hte build failed; 0 for pass; 1 for failed

messages.title: messages are some descriptions of each stage that are generated at runtime

startTime.title: startTime is when this stage began execution

stageDuration.title: stageDuration is how long the stage took to execute

modelsStageStatus.title: StageStatus is the detailed information about a specific stage that was executed during the build

buildSum.title: buildSum is the BuildSummary object that correlates to the build in question

stages.title: stages is a all the StageStatus objects associated to the build in question

isInConsul.title: isInConsul is a boolean that is used for determining if the build is "running" or not. if isInConsul=true, the build is still running

modelsSubCredType.title:
- BITBUCKET: / VCS ///
 - NEXUS: / REPO ///

 - SLACK: / NOTIFY ///

clientId.title:
clientId is generated by creating an oAuth consumer in bitbucket. it is required to generate tokens.
@inject_tag: yaml:"clientId"

clientSecret.title:
clientSecret is generated by creating an oAuth consumer in bitbucket. it is required to generate tokens.

identifier.title: identifier is the name the user calls teh credential set

tokenURL.title:
tokenUrl is the url at which to retrieve the token
@inject_tag: yaml:"tokenURL"

acctName is the account to associate the VCSCred with. Must be the account name of the owner of the repository they wish to track (ie level11consulting)

sshFileLoc.title:
just a string that says whether or not there is an ssh key on file

there is only one subtype that is valid for VCS creds at this time, and it is BITBUCKET
@inject_tag: yaml:"subType"

protobufEmpty.title:
A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
or the response type of an API method. For instance:
